alert.note: Alert for Chester; Hardeman; Madison (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 7:59PM CDT until July 04 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Chester County in Tennessee... Northern Hardeman County in Tennessee... Southwestern Madison County in Tennessee... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 759 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bolivar, Chickasaw State Forest, Chickasaw State Park, Silerton, Cloverport, Mercer, Toone, Medon, Teague, Uptonville, Shandy, Deanburg, Parkburg and Hatchie. This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek, Pleasant Run, Lacy Creek, Sugar Creek, Piney Creek, Melton Branch, Hatchie River, Pennycost Creek, Cypress Creek, Meridian Creek, Short Creek, Jeffers Creek, Hickory Creek, Turkey Branch, Turkey Creek, Clover Creek, Spring Creek, Dry Branch, Pugh Creek, Pinner Creek, Sweeton Branch, Dry Creek, Clear Creek, Sour Branch, Chisholm Creek, May Branch, Hart Creek, Sandy Creek, Johnson Creek, Gaylor Creek, Muddy Creek, Potters Creek, South Fork Forked Deer River and Bear Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
